arundel.core

Interface Gate

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Operator, Placeholder, Variable

    public interface Gate
    A Gate is the basic building block for the computational directed acyclic graph (DAG). A gate has certain inputs, it can perform some computation on these inputs and produces some outputs as a result of this computation, which in turn maybe the inputs for some other Gates.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void backward()
      Method to compute the backward computation for this gate.
      void forward()
      Method to compute the forward computation for this gate.
      java.util.List<Link> inputs()
      Returns the list of input links (incoming edges) for this Gate.
      java.util.List<Link> outputs()
      Returns the list of output links (outgoing edges) for this Gate.
      void update()
      Update the parmameters of this gate on the basis of backward computation.

    • Method Detail

        Update the parmameters of this gate on the basis of backward computation.

      • inputs

        java.util.List<Link> inputs()
        Returns the list of input links (incoming edges) for this Gate.
        Returns:
        a List of Links, null if no inputs

      • outputs

        java.util.List<Link> outputs()
        Returns the list of output links (outgoing edges) for this Gate.
        Returns:
        a List of Links
